Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is encrusted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of three lines of fine Coptic text written in black ink, faded in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.175)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36396) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36396)
Condition: fair (text faded and smudged in places)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 253 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13442 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
